issue.title: [C++] Build JSON "scanner" for reading record batches from line-delimited JSON files
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-694](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-694). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Umbrella issue for using RapidJSON to parse JSON files to Arrow record batches

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-694?focusedCommentId=16634157) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Seems we could use the RapidJSON SAX API for parsing files with 1 JSON object per line: http://rapidjson.org/md_doc_sax.html

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-694?focusedCommentId=16688470) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
I just wrote up a Google doc about this with some links to JSON support in other analytics tools

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-694?focusedCommentId=16766136) by Neville Dipale (nevi_me):*
Maybe this isn't related to this JIRA, but JSON schema (<https://json-schema.org/)> seems to be growing in adoption. We might consider supporting inferring/creating record schemas from a supplied JSON schema in future.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-694?focusedCommentId=16773076) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Issue resolved by pull request 3592
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3592>
